insights: Most projects (9 out of 11) are already in production, indicating mature development cycle
Strong focus on personalization features (menu personalization, ad progression, merchandising widgets)
Multiple infrastructure and platform automation initiatives (Databricks, multi-region deployment, FreshChat integration)
Cross-functional collaboration is common with multiple alliances/tribes working together on projects
GitHub repositories are primary documentation source for technical projects
Menu Search feature shows phased rollout strategy (MVP in Chefs Plate, then CK/CA/US markets)
Data and analytics capabilities being enhanced (Business Marts, Databricks automation)
Consumer experience improvements span multiple touchpoints (ads, funnels, menus, cooking experience)
Follow-up tracking shows mixed completion status with both 'x' and 'o' markers
Projects span multiple mega alliances: Customer, Growth, Operations, Consumer, and Foundations

results.purpose: Track and manage trial box subscription resets for TPT (pet food) customers in KN (Kenya) market who experienced payment failures, and cancel subscriptions with 5+ failed payment attempts

entities.name: New Ventures Tech team
entities.context: Responsible for manually resetting subscriptions back to trial SKU

entities.name: TPT (The Pets Table)
entities.context: Pet food subscription service offering trial boxes to new customers

entities.name: BOB (Back Office Backend)
entities.context: System used for bulk subscription cancellations and management

entities.name: #squad-nv-pet-food
entities.context: Slack channel for requesting engineer support for subscription resets

entities.name: Databricks
entities.context: Data platform where queries are executed

insights: Process runs on a bi-weekly schedule: Tuesdays (covering Sat-Tue deliveries) and Fridays (covering Wed-Fri deliveries)
Two-tier approach: subscriptions with 5+ failed payments are canceled, while those with fewer failures are reset to trial status
4-week grace period: trial boxes reset for over 4 weeks with continued payment failures trigger subscription cancellation
Query filters for trial boxes only (is_trialbox = TRUE) with dunning_decision = 'cancel' and excludes already shipped/paid orders
Manual coordination required between operations team and engineering team via Slack for subscription resets
Process prevents accumulation of failed weekly order creations while honoring trial pricing for legitimate customers

results.doc_title: Research Roadmap & Project Tracking (GCI + IXI + USCI + GCX)
results.purpose: Tracks research projects and initiatives across multiple brands (HelloFresh, Factor_, Green Chef) and regions, managing project status, ownership, timelines, and strategic alignment
key_data_points: 4 project statuses tracked: Requested, Planned, In Flight, Complete
3 primary team flags: GCI-led, IXI-led, USCI-led, Prod Analytics-led
Multiple brands: HelloFresh, Factor_, Green Chef, Internal tools
Geographic coverage: US, Canada, Sweden, Global
6 strategic anchors: Foundational Insights, Cultural Relevance, Consumer Closeness, Value Perception, Efficiency, Creative & Campaign Evaluation, Menu Expansion
Project timeline spans from 2025 Q1 through 2026 Q2

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Primary brand with most projects across multiple markets

entities.name: Factor_
entities.context: Health-focused meal brand with menu expansion and customer research initiatives

entities.name: Green Chef
entities.context: Brand with completed loyalty deep dive study

entities.name: Bassem Elhelaly
entities.context: Primary driver for GCI-led projects including Consumer Closeness campaigns and GCS reporting

entities.name: Anne Laesecke
entities.context: Driver for USCI-led projects focused on Factor_ menu expansion and customer preferences

entities.name: Patrick Roney
entities.context: Approver for multiple USCI-led projects

entities.name: Dan-Octavian Balica
entities.context: Approver for GCI-led projects

entities.name: Joanna Lindenberg
entities.context: Approver and consultant on multiple projects

entities.name: GCS (Global Customer Survey)
entities.context: Quarterly tracking survey being revamped for 2026

entities.name: Influencer Marketplace
entities.context: Strategic initiative to create 'Shopify for Food' platform

insights: GCI-led projects dominate the roadmap, indicating centralized research operations
Consumer Closeness is a major focus with parallel campaigns for Factor_ and HelloFresh running weekly drop-in sessions
Factor_ has significant planned research in Q1-Q2 2026 focused on menu expansion (oven-heated meals, gluten formats, longevity/food-as-medicine)
Most completed projects (Status 4) are GCI-led, suggesting strong execution from this team
Strategic focus areas include: #2 Menu Expansion, #3 Cultural Relevance, #1 Value Perception, #5 Efficiency
Customer loyalty and retention are emerging concerns with multiple planned studies on 'super loyal customers' and cancellation reasons
GCS survey system is undergoing major revamp to become omnibus-type survey
Cross-functional collaboration is evident with multiple stakeholders (Consulted/Informed) on most projects
Geographic expansion focus on US market with some global and international (Sweden, Canada) initiatives

results.purpose: Track and manage trial box subscription resets for TPT (pet food) customers in KN (Kenya) market who experienced payment failures, and cancel subscriptions with 5+ failed payment attempts
key_data_points: Reset timeframe: 4 weeks before final cancellation

entities.name: New Ventures Tech team
entities.context: Responsible for manually resetting subscriptions back to trial SKU

entities.name: TPT (The Pet Table)
entities.context: Pet food subscription service offering trial boxes to new customers

entities.name: #squad-nv-pet-food
entities.context: Slack channel for submitting engineering requests for subscription resets

entities.name: BOB (Back Office Backend)
entities.context: Tool used for bulk subscription cancellations and management

entities.name: Databricks
entities.context: Database platform where queries are executed

entities.name: CC KN Reset tab
entities.context: Spreadsheet tab tracking customer care reset requests

insights: Two-tier process: subscriptions with 5+ failed payments are canceled immediately, while those with fewer failures are reset to trial status
Bi-weekly schedule: Tuesday runs cover Saturday-Tuesday deliveries, Friday runs cover Wednesday-Friday deliveries
Trial boxes are smaller and lower-priced than regular boxes, requiring special handling to honor promotional pricing
Process prevents indefinite order creation for non-paying customers while giving legitimate customers a second chance
Automated query identifies candidates, but manual intervention required for both cancellations (via BOB) and resets (via engineering team)
Filters ensure only active, unshipped trial subscriptions with payment errors are processed
4-week grace period before final cancellation allows multiple retry attempts for payment resolution

results.purpose: Tracks marketing test campaigns and A/B tests for Good Chop across different channels (SEM, Facebook, CRM, Direct Mail) with various promotional offers and pricing structures
key_data_points: Campaign naming convention: Quarter [Channel] Offer Description
Pricing structures: $30, $100, $110, $120, $140, $150 with various discount splits
Promotional offers: Free Ground Beef, Free Ribeyes, Welcome Kits (A & B), Choose Your Offer/Meat/Protein
Geographic variants: Standard US and Canada (CA) specific tests

entities.name: kelly.abrams@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of SEM (Search Engine Marketing) campaign tests for both New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand channels

entities.name: yukie.yamamoto@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of Facebook (FB) advertising campaign tests

entities.name: yt@hellofresh.com
entities.context: Owner of CRM (Customer Relationship Management) and Direct Mail (DM) campaign tests; appears to be from parent company HelloFresh

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Meat subscription service conducting marketing tests, appears to be owned by or affiliated with HelloFresh

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Parent or partner company, email domain for CRM/DM campaign owner

insights: Good Chop runs systematic A/B tests comparing different promotional offers (free products vs. dollar discounts vs. welcome kits)
Marketing channels are clearly segmented: SEM (subdivided into New Business, Competitor, Brand), Facebook, CRM, and Direct Mail
Discount structures follow a pattern of multi-order incentives (e.g., 50-30-20 means $50 off order 1, $30 off order 2, $20 off order 3)
Q3 2025 campaigns focus heavily on $100-$120 offers with ground beef promotions, while Q2 2025 emphasized ribeye steak offers
There's a shift in ownership: older campaigns (2023-early 2024) owned by HelloFresh email, newer campaigns (2025) owned by Good Chop domain emails
Facebook channel shows the most test variations (often 3-way tests indicated by [3] suffix)
Canada market receives separate, tailored test campaigns (indicated by -CA suffix)
Most recent activity concentrated in Q2-Q3 2025 with last modified dates in June-July 2025
Welcome Kit variations (A and B) are frequently tested elements across multiple channels

results.purpose: Track and manage trial box subscription resets for TPT (pet food) customers in KN (Kenya) market who experienced payment failures, and cancel subscriptions with 5+ failed payment attempts

entities.name: New Ventures Tech team
entities.context: Responsible for manually resetting subscriptions back to trial SKU

entities.name: TPT customers
entities.context: New pet food customers entitled to trial boxes

entities.name: BOB (Back Office Backend)
entities.context: System used for bulk subscription cancellations and management

entities.name: #squad-nv-pet-food
entities.context: Slack channel for requesting engineer support for subscription resets

entities.name: Databricks
entities.context: Database platform where queries are executed

insights: Process runs on a bi-weekly schedule: Tuesdays (covering Sat-Tue deliveries) and Fridays (covering Wed-Fri deliveries)
Two-tier approach: subscriptions with 5+ failed payments are canceled, while those with fewer failures are reset to trial status
4-week grace period: trial boxes reset for over 4 weeks with continued payment failures should be canceled
Only unshipped boxes with payment errors are considered (box_shipped = 0, dunning_decision = 'cancel')
Process requires manual coordination between operations team and engineering team via Slack
Focuses exclusively on new customers (customer_loyalty = 0) to honor trial pricing commitments
Uses specific status filters to exclude successfully processed orders ('shipped', 'money_received')

results.purpose: Pricing comparison for VMS (meal) products between OTP (One-Time Purchase) and SNS (Subscribe and Save) models, showing different discount tiers based on order value thresholds
key_data_points: Shipping cost threshold changed from $50 (before OTP) to $65 (after OTP)
SNS first box discount: 40% off above MOV (Minimum Order Value), 10% off below MOV
SNS second box onward discount: 20% off above MOV, 10% off below MOV
Shipping cost for orders below threshold: $5.99 (single items) or $0 (multi-packs)
Product sizes range from 1 to 4 boxes per order
Greens flavor products priced higher ($78.99 base) than chocolate/vanilla ($34.99 base)
Bulk products start at $69.00 per box

entities.name: VMS
entities.context: Main product line with multiple flavors (chocolate, vanilla, greens, lemonlime, bloodorangeyuzu, passionfruitguava, variety, bulk)

entities.name: OTP
entities.context: One-Time Purchase pricing model introduced as new purchasing option

entities.name: SNS
entities.context: Subscribe and Save model with tiered discounts for first and subsequent boxes

entities.name: FJ
entities.context: Brand prefix in product handles (e.g., FJ-VMS-1-1-0)

insights: Two-tiered subscription pricing strategy: aggressive 40% discount for first box to acquire customers, then 20% for retention
Premium pricing for greens flavor (~2.25x base chocolate/vanilla price)
Bulk products (8-box size) offered at discounted per-unit pricing
Free shipping incentive at $50+ (before) and $65+ (after) encourages larger orders
Product variety increases with order size (1-4 boxes) with mix-and-match options
Consistent pricing structure: OTP price equals original price, with SNS providing the only discounts
MOV threshold creates clear pricing tiers to drive higher order values
Single-item orders incur $5.99 shipping, creating strong incentive for multi-box purchases

entities.name: BOB (Back Office Backend)
entities.context: System used for bulk subscription cancellations and management

entities.name: #squad-nv-pet-food

insights: Two-tier process: subscriptions with 5+ failed payments are canceled immediately, while those with fewer failures are reset to trial status

results.purpose: Pricing comparison for VMS (meal) products between OTP (One-Time Purchase) and SNS (Subscribe and Save) models, showing different discount tiers based on order value and subscription status
key_data_points: SNS First Box discount: 40% off above MOV (Minimum Order Value), 10% off below MOV
SNS Second Box onward discount: 20% off above MOV, 10% off below MOV
Shipping costs: $5.99 for orders below threshold, $0 for orders above
Product flavors: chocolate, vanilla, greens, lemonlime, bloodorangeyuzu, passionfruitguava, bulk, variety

entities.name: VMS
entities.context: Main product line with various flavor combinations and box quantities (1-4 boxes)

entities.name: OTP
entities.context: One-Time Purchase pricing model with $65 minimum for free shipping

entities.name: SNS
entities.context: Subscribe and Save model offering tiered discounts (40%/20% above MOV, 10% below MOV)

entities.name: FJ
entities.context: Brand prefix in all product handles (e.g., FJ-VMS-1-1-0)

insights: SNS first box offers aggressive 40% discount above MOV to incentivize subscription adoption
Discount drops to 20% for subsequent boxes, maintaining customer retention while improving margins
Greens flavor products are premium priced ($78.99 for 1 box vs $34.99 for chocolate/vanilla)
Bulk products introduced at competitive pricing ($68.99 per box)
Free shipping threshold increased from $50 to $65 after OTP introduction
All multi-box orders (2+) qualify for free shipping under original pricing
Product variety increases significantly with 4-box combinations, offering extensive customization
Below MOV pricing maintains consistent 10% discount across both first and subsequent SNS boxes
